Stem: Ribbed, pale green, erect to prostrate with age. Somewhat hollow.
Leaves: Dark green, 5-20 cm long tapering at end, with serrated and wavy edges, on short stalks.
Flowers: White pom-pom-like flowers up to 2 cm diameter in groups at the end of stems.
FruitSeeds: Seeds are yellowish brown, 5 mm in diameter, and ribbed.
Habitat: Creeks, floodplains, dams, wetlands, can grow fully submerged.
DistinguishingFeatures: Somewhat hollow stems, and combination of characteristics distinguish from Siam Weed, Crofton Weed and Hygrophila.
